Package com.github.fmeum.rules_jni

Class RulesJni

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fmeum.rules_jni.RulesJni
  • public class RulesJni
extends java.lang.Object
    Static helper methods that load native libraries created with the cc_jni_library rule of rules_jni.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void loadLibrary​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class<?> inSamePackageAs)
      Loads a native library created with the cc_jni_library rule from the resource directory of the class inSamePackageAs.
      static void loadLibrary​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String absolutePathToPackage)
      Loads a native library created with the cc_jni_library rule from the resource directory specified by the absolute path absolutePathToPackage.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • loadLibrary

        public static void loadLibrary​(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.Class<?> inSamePackageAs)
        Loads a native library created with the cc_jni_library rule from the resource directory of the class inSamePackageAs. The correct version of the native library for the current OS and CPU architecture is chosen automatically. All temporary files created during the extraction of the native library are cleaned up at JVM exit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cc_jni_library target that generates the native library to be loaded.
        inSamePackageAs - a class that is contained in the same Java (or Bazel) package as the native library.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if name or inSamePackageAs is null.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkLink method doesn't allow loading of the specified dynamic library.
        java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError - if a version of the library for the current OS and CPU architecture could not be found in the resource directory corresponding to inSamePackageAs.

      • loadLibrary

        public static void loadLibrary​(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String absolutePathToPackage)
        Loads a native library created with the cc_jni_library rule from the resource directory specified by the absolute path absolutePathToPackage. The correct version of the native library for the current OS and CPU architecture is chosen automatically. All temporary files created during the extraction of the native library are cleaned up at JVM exit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cc_jni_library target that generates the native library to be loaded.
        absolutePathToPackage - a class that is contained in the same Java (or Bazel) package as the native library.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if name or absolutePathToPackage is null.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkLink method doesn't allow loading of the specified dynamic library.
        java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError - if a version of the library for the current OS and CPU architecture could not be found at specified resource path.
